channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Snowboarder's death in Swiss Alps avalanche is a reminder that even pros face risk
item.description: The death of an Olympic snowboarding athlete is a reminder that even the most skilled and experienced athletes are not immune to the threat of avalanches, and that knowledge is key to staying safe.
item.content:encoded:
The death of an Olympic snowboarding athlete is a reminder that even the most skilled and experienced athletes are not immune to the threat of avalanches, and that knowledge is key to staying safe.

(Image credit: Millo Moravski/Agence Zoom/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: Scientists await signal from spacecraft after historic close encounter with the sun
item.description: To get so close, the Parker Solar Probe had to withstand the sun's extreme heat and radiation like no spacecraft before it.
item.content:encoded:
To get so close, the Parker Solar Probe had to withstand the sun's extreme heat and radiation like no spacecraft before it.

(Image credit: Steve Gribben/AP)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Mega Millions jackpot surges past $1 billion
item.description: The Mega Millions prize has now grown to an estimated $1.15 billion, which could be the fifth-largest jackpot in the game's history.
item.content:encoded:
The Mega Millions prize has now grown to an estimated $1.15 billion, which could be the fifth-largest jackpot in the game's history.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: Pope urges 'all people of all nations' to silence arms in Christmas address
item.description: Pope Francis in his traditional Christmas message urged "all people of all nations" to find courage "to silence the sounds of arms and overcome divisions" plaguing the world, from the Middle East to Ukraine, Africa to Asia.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis in his traditional Christmas message urged "all people of all nations" to find courage "to silence the sounds of arms and overcome divisions" plaguing the world, from the Middle East to Ukraine, Africa to Asia.

(Image credit: Andrew Medichini)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A gang attack on a Haitian hospital reopening kills 2 reporters and a police officer
item.description: Street gangs forced the General Hospital in Port-au-Prince to close earlier this year. As journalists gathered to cover its reopening, suspected gang members opened fire.
item.content:encoded:
Street gangs forced the General Hospital in Port-au-Prince to close earlier this year. As journalists gathered to cover its reopening, suspected gang members opened fire.

(Image credit: Odelyn Joseph)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Far from the front lines, Ukrainians fight a war to preserve their culture
item.description: In the Transcarpathia region, some locals embrace a traditional lifestyle and cultural identity. After surviving Soviet threats, now they fear President Vladimir Putin seeks to erase their culture.
item.content:encoded:
In the Transcarpathia region, some locals embrace a traditional lifestyle and cultural identity. After surviving Soviet threats, now they fear President Vladimir Putin seeks to erase their culture.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: Claire Harbage

item.title: Russia targets Ukrainian energy infrastructure on Christmas Day
item.description: Russia's massive missile and drone barrage struck a thermal power plant and prompted Ukrainians to shelter in metro stations on Christmas morning.
item.content:encoded:
Russia's massive missile and drone barrage struck a thermal power plant and prompted Ukrainians to shelter in metro stations on Christmas morning.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: When kindness becomes a habit, it improves our health
item.description: Whether it's volunteering at a local school or taking soup to a sick neighbor, improving the welfare of others can also improve our own physical and mental health, a sizable body of research shows.
item.content:encoded:
Whether it's volunteering at a local school or taking soup to a sick neighbor, improving the welfare of others can also improve our own physical and mental health, a sizable body of research shows.

(Image credit: Olga Rolenko)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: 'The Bachelor,' Ukraine edition, features a veteran who lost both legs in the war
item.description: He wants to give hope to the tens of thousands of Ukrainians who have lost limbs since Russia's 2022 invasion of Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
He wants to give hope to the tens of thousands of Ukrainians who have lost limbs since Russia's 2022 invasion of Ukraine.

(Image credit: Oksana Parafeniuk for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Want government money for a heat pump? Time might be running out
item.description: The Biden administration introduced new consumer tax credits for climate-friendly heat pumps. What does a Trump administration and GOP-led congress mean for that money?
item.content:encoded:
The Biden administration introduced new consumer tax credits for climate-friendly heat pumps. What does a Trump administration and GOP-led congress mean for that money?

(Image credit: ANDREW CABALLERO-REYNOLDS/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon
